DataElement.preferredName: Accelerated Phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Positive Cytogenetic Response Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease status or response to treatment of accelerated phase chronic myelogenous leukemia based on a cytogenetic evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Accelerated Phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Positive Cytogenetic Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A phase of chronic myelogenous leukemia characterized by one or more of the following: 1) Myeloblasts accounting for 10-19% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow, 2) peripheral blood basophils at least 20%, 3) persistent thrombocytopenia that is unrelated to therapy, 4) persistent thrombocytosis despite adequate therapy, 5) increasing white blood cell count and increasing spleen size unresponsive to therapy, and/or evidence of clonal evolution. (WHO, 2001)_An evaluation of the cytogenetic response of the disease to the therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredName: Accelerated Phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Positive Cytogenetic Response
Property.preferredDefinition: A phase of chronic myelogenous leukemia characterized by one or more of the following: 1) Myeloblasts accounting for 10-19% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow, 2) peripheral blood basophils at least 20%, 3) persistent thrombocytopenia that is unrelated to therapy, 4) persistent thrombocytosis despite adequate therapy, 5) increasing white blood cell count and increasing spleen size unresponsive to therapy, and/or evidence of clonal evolution. (WHO, 2001):An evaluation of the cytogenetic response of the disease to the therapy.

Concepts.longName: Accelerated Phase Chronic Myeloid Leukemia, BCR-ABL1 Positive
Concepts.definition: A phase of chronic myeloid leukemia characterized by one or more of the following: 1) Myeloblasts accounting for 10-19% of the peripheral blood white cells or of the nucleated cells in the bone marrow, 2) peripheral blood basophils at least 20%, 3) persistent thrombocytopenia that is unrelated to therapy, 4) persistent thrombocytosis despite adequate therapy, 5) increasing white blood cell count and increasing spleen size unresponsive to therapy, and/or evidence of clonal evolution. (WHO, 2001)
An evaluation of the cytogenetic response of the disease to the therapy.
